content.p: Many users today work from multiple sites (e.g. both home and work), or use multiple web browsers for different tasks. It can be cumbersome trying to keep these different sets of bookmarks in synch with each other.

Such a problem lends itself well to a hosted solution. Rather than keeping bookmarks separately in each browser, bookmarks are stored on an internet server, and can be easily accessed and updated from any location with internet access.
So the objective of project Marco is as follows:

div.p: To provide a hosted bookmarks service that can be used to access and maintain a list of bookmarks for multiple users over the internet.

content.p: As a "proof of concept", I've developed a single-user hosted bookmarks application, which I am currently using both at home and at work. This can be found here. It requires a modern browser (Mozilla 0.8 or Internet Explorer 5.5 will do nicely).

ul.li: HTML viewing mode, with collapsable categories
HTML editing mode, with links for deleting and maintaining categories and bookmarks
HTML forms for editing / creating bookmarks and categories.
Simple digest authentication to prevent unauthorized modifications.
Oracle XDK to produce XML from SQL and transform it to HTML using XSLT
W3C DOM level 2 and CSS level 2 for client niceties (form validation, collapsing categories etc.)
